text: Now tell me again when you will ask me a question?
WHY WHY do you keep making changes
You're not polling. What is it that I am failing to tell you?
Now look at the logs that we have right now of ongoing training. What can you conclude from reading those logs?
@docs/experiment_plan.md we ran all these hypothesis. No improvements are happening. Diagnose, no changes
Read @tuning_plan.md, what would you change?
put a to do docstring at the top of the build domain manifest script about this issue. put in known issues document. Don't put a single or two liner, be a little more detailed.
Why do you keep doing this? Why do you not do the timeout polls?
do not use streaming model. Change everything else.
Leave it. Does it end abruptly?
No I only want shortcut window or panel for fugitive. Alternatively, put shortcuts in the top of init.lua as docstrings or something
DIAGNOSIS. ONLY ASKED FOR DIAGNOSIS
Does @plan.md account for these?
Didn't we agree to use just commands?
That is when the plan stops. Asked when will you stop once you start?
run_20260219_140512.log - Why do the number of samples stay the same? I thought the domain manifest now has more samples.
If we continue down this training route, how big of a model can we train?
Why doesn't it appear when I do ? in neotree?
That moonshine paper seems very old. Are you sure it's the v2 paper. Did you actually read it?
Look @docs/training_report.md @docs/training.md @docs/known_issues.md . Why are we not getting any gains in training?
in a diff view in git fugitive how do I go to that file at that position
what is FCP?
Fix the linting errors.
IF a process is working in the background but it does logging, can we see the logs somehow outside of the process?
Training should have been V2 from the start. What should we change about the documentation, etcetera?
write a voice.md. Write your full plan in there.
In the diff view how do I stage, unstage?
You did not keep your shell open. Why are you doing this? Why can't you keep it open?
Content from @docs/moonshine.md:
is the training still really improving?
Nope don't want this - setup_logging(output_dir="outputs") . The application code should not change
Review @docs/training.md Is this type of trainingfeasible to do on a Mac M3.
Content from @docs/training_report.md:
.temp ToDo*
Is @plan.md a better plan now?
Is any thing even running?
No, I even want the UX code itself to be a separate package. Tell me what that separate package will look like?
Read again the guidance criteria and tell me what you will do and when you will stop.
neovim, how do I copy the filename from neotree?
Did you just stop? What did we agree on?
Go search for the docs for moonshine including any research docs. Download it, read it and then create the docs, put direct links to it in the doc
What is the build manifest for?
Is that intentional to have the last fifty be easier?
open /src/main.py
Content from @plan.md:
No, you will not stop if you are stuck. You will use best practices to unstuck yourself.
Look at all the recent log files. Do any of the experiment variations yield any benefits?
Make sure arguments are logged.
Okay, start and do not stop until all acceptance criteria is met.
is mermaid the best way to illustrate this. Think harder but don't change anything. Tell me what other ways we could do this
You have the capability to read PDFs, download it, read it, do not give me abstract data.
It seems to be plateauing. Does the lower learn rate not mean that it's actually struggling to learn?
why do I not see a diff view using fugitive. That's the main thing I want, a good diff view
Why do you think loss is improving but WER is not?
you will run out of tokens if you read that file full
Wait, did you make changes to code? REvert them. I asked you to debug, not to change code.
That is not what I meant, and you are completely going in the wrong direction. The current objective is to prove that fine tuning works at all. What I told you is the eventual objective.
Stop reading continuously. Just poll at some second intervals.
WHY are you so lazy. I could find relevant files here - ~/.gemini/tmp/. DO NOT do anythong. Tell me why you are so lkazy
review @refactor.md and the codebase. Will it fix the current issues?
do you have access to our transcripts. For example in ~/.gemini. Can you search in detail and create the raw data to use for starting recording process
Read docs/experiment_plan.md and Current state of training. Run logs are available in outputs folder. Can you diagnose why no improvements are happening?
Merge all make files into the just file.
Content from @refactor.md:
Look @plan.md @docs/training_report.md @docs/training.md @docs/known_issues.md . Why are we not getting any gains in training?
Write a detailed docs/inference.md With your findings and properly structured.
What? Just the case can change WER from 1 to 0? That does not make any sense.
git push origin main
look at the other posts in the folder. Then come back to this post and review again, and give me all your thoughts
why do you insist on not using uv
Does all that research help in any way in determining how we should proceed in terms of our fine tuning?
Content from @docs/experiment_plan.md:
What does stopping only after everything is done mean?
You're just going around in circles. = E447: Can't find file "vim/keymap/set" in path Press ENTER or type command to continue
create docs/personalized_training.md. put everything you have learnt until now in there. Then add a full plan including all tooling etc needed to do the custom training
switch to the v2 architecture
let's actually reread the blog post. Tell me if there's something obviously incorrect?
Add your suggestions to the experiment plan document as a new experiment line.
Polling should be via a timeout
read @plan.md Can this plan be done with the just file?
You're not doing a very good job. WER evaluation keeps happening at various intervals. You only looked at the last interval. You did not do a very good job researching the logs.
After training is complete, how would inference look like? Is there a way of optimizing inference? Does that involve changing the data into a different format?
surely jekyll or minimal mistakes has a plugin for this
Now will you again be lazy on my query? Create technical minded data relevant for the recording session by detailed going through transcripts
I didn't see you download any paper. Show me actual citation data from inside the paper to verify that you actually read the paper.
And then why did you stop?
Based on everything you understand, can you update the experiment plan and the execution plan? And do nothing else.
Rewrite plan.md with your plan. Make sure it has verification and acceptance criteria. Make sure acceptance critera has training report. What would be the hypothesis?
Make the docstring in that file have all the things that you just said.
Look @docs/experiment_plan.md Why are we still unable to improve any benchmarks?
revert that last commit
At least put it as documentation in top of the doc string in init.lua
continue. you are trying to read a too big file. Make sure you use head, tail etc To not read too big of a file.
what is this going around in circles
Isn't your experiment plan based on the wrong model?
You completely got rid of the previous guidance section.
I will remove it since it brings nothing to the table. Now explain the significance of RSC in the diagram. Why is it important that we point out RSC?
Look @docs/training_report.md. Why do you think no progress was made in the training?
Write a verification criteria and stopping criteria into the plan. Can all of that be done with the existing state of the package?
And will you stop at any point? And when will you stop?
No files matching the criteria were found or all were skipped.
Would it help if you write the moonshine docs? Even though it does not do Lora?
